Sentencas: Catalytic properties of substituted lanthanum chromites were investigated for their use as anode materials for direct methane oxidation in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anode materials.
Titulo: Lanthanum chromite based catalysts for oxidation of methane directly on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: Different reaction mixtures were chosen to simulate the various SOFC operating conditions: partial oxidation, CO2 reforming by recycling, and H2O reforming.
Titulo: Lanthanum chromite based catalysts for oxidation of methane directly on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: All experiments were performed in methane-rich atmospheres.
Titulo: Lanthanum chromite based catalysts for oxidation of methane directly on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: Alkaline earth elements such as Ca, Sr, and Mg, and first series transition metals-Mn, Fe, Co, and Ni-were substituted into the LaCrO3 lattice.
Titulo: Lanthanum chromite based catalysts for oxidation of methane directly on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: Three different catalytic behaviors were observed depending on the substituents.
Titulo: Lanthanum chromite based catalysts for oxidation of methane directly on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: The Ni-substituted powders showed the highest activity toward CH4.
Titulo: Lanthanum chromite based catalysts for oxidation of methane directly on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: Ni substitution showed also interesting H2O and CO2 reforming activities.
Titulo: Lanthanum chromite based catalysts for oxidation of methane directly on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: For all catalysts, except in the case of Fe-substituted LaCrO3, only a small amount of carbon was detected on the surface (1 similar to3 monolayers).
Titulo: Lanthanum chromite based catalysts for oxidation of methane directly on SOFC anodes

Sentencas: Among the investigated A-site and B-site substitutents, Sr and Ni were found to be the most active and the most suitable substitutents for the LaCrO3 SOFC anode purpose.
Titulo: Lanthanum chromite based catalysts for oxidation of methane directly on SOFC anodes
Lanthanum chromite based catalysts for oxidation of methane directly on SOFC anodes
